about_description:
This tool normalizes audio files using FFmpeg's loudnorm filter.
- Supports WAV, MP3, FLAC, AAC, OGG and more.
- Customizable LUFS and True Peak targets.
- Presets for common platforms like YouTube and Spotify.
- Log file for FFmpeg output.
- Options dialog for settings.
about_opensource: This is open-source software, freely available under the MIT License.

WAV.description: Uncompressed and lossless. The professional standard for mastering, archiving, and as a high-quality source for further processing.

MP3.description: Creates an MP3 file at the maximum standard bitrate. This ensures excellent audio quality with the highest compatibility across all devices.

FLAC.description: Reduces file size significantly compared to WAV, but without any loss of audio information. The premier choice for archival.

AAC.description: A modern and efficient codec that often provides better quality than MP3 at the same bitrate. The standard for the Apple ecosystem.

OGG.description: An open-source format encoded at its maximum constant bitrate. This ensures the highest possible quality for the Vorbis codec.
